remarks: Two functions defined on a ball whose derivatives are the same and which are equal at any given point ` C ` in the ball must be equal everywhere.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)
statement:
dv11cn.x $e |- X = ( A ( ball ` ( abs o. - ) ) R ) $.
dv11cn.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. CC ) $.
dv11cn.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR* ) $.
dv11cn.f $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> CC ) $.
dv11cn.g $e |- ( ph -> G : X --> CC ) $.
dv11cn.d $e |- ( ph -> dom ( CC _D F ) = X ) $.
dv11cn.e $e |- ( ph -> ( CC _D F ) = ( CC _D G ) ) $.
dv11cn.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. X ) $.
dv11cn.p $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` C ) = ( G ` C ) ) $.
dv11cn $p |- ( ph -> F = G ) $.
